lines.text: The country still needs men who know how to handle a gun, Jack.
Gunfighters?
We call them detectives.

The country is still growing. It's young and raw. The West is plagued with desperate, vicious men with guns in their hands. We need good men who know how to handle a gun - men like your father. You got a job if you want it.
[the Wild Bunch makes their getaway after holding up a train]
That's the Wild Bunch! That's the Wild Bunch!
Yeah.
That's livin'! I call that livin'!
It's a good way of dyin', too.
[to prevent Johnny from following him into the Wild Bunch's hideout, Jack knocks him out at the train depot]
Sorry, compadre.
Say, I thought he was your friend.
He is. Take care of him.
What am I going to do with him?
Just keep the flies off him!
You gonna be sure to take her to Sunday School next Sunday!
When you see me in church, Abilene, you'll be starin' up out of a pine box and I'll be readin' out of my prayer book.
Some day, Harry, someone's gonna fill you so full of lead, they'll stake a claim on ya.
[after helping the Wild Bunch rob a gold-carrying wagon, Abilene robs a minister riding as a passenger]
Give!
Abilene! Not him.
Alright, man of God - keep your pennies.
Look, why are you in the Hole in the Wall?
Because I can eat whenever I get hungry - and I get hungry often. Sound reasonable?
